body_html:
Thanks, it was the big #ifdef GOOGLE_CUDA was the problem. It looks like there is already ab implementation, at least the convolution utilizes FFT (

tensorflow/third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/src/NeuralNetworks/TensorConvolutionByFFT.h

Line 234 in e39d8fe

Tensor<std::complex<Scalar>, NumDims, Layout, TensorIndex> kernel_fft = kernel_variant.template fft<Eigen::BothParts, FFT_FORWARD>(fft);
). Maybe I'm misunderstanding this line (the .template is a little bit confusing).
body_text:
Thanks, it was the big #ifdef GOOGLE_CUDA was the problem. It looks like there is already ab implementation, at least the convolution utilizes FFT (
  
    
      tensorflow/third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/src/NeuralNetworks/TensorConvolutionByFFT.h
    
    
         Line 234
      in
      e39d8fe
    
    
    
    

        
          
           Tensor<std::complex<Scalar>, NumDims, Layout, TensorIndex> kernel_fft =  kernel_variant.template fft<Eigen::BothParts, FFT_FORWARD>(fft); 
        
    
  

). Maybe I'm misunderstanding this line (the .template is a little bit confusing).
body: Thanks, it was the big `#ifdef GOOGLE_CUDA` was the problem. It looks like there is already ab implementation, at least the convolution utilizes FFT (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/e39d8feebb9666a331345cd8d960f5ade4652bba/third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/src/NeuralNetworks/TensorConvolutionByFFT.h#L234). Maybe I'm misunderstanding this line (the `.template` is a little bit confusing).
